meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 16 ounces.
meanings.sent1: She placed five pounds of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: The butcher sells meat by the pounds.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to carry a whole pound of fish in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: His love for her weighed more than a thousand pounds of gold.

meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of the United Kingdom.
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for British pounds at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The price of the item was listed in pounds and pence.
meanings.sent3: She found a lucky penny and hoped it would turn into a pound.
meanings.sent4: His savings were in pounds, ready for his trip to London.
meanings.sent5: The pound coin had a picture of the Queen on it.

meanings.sent1: He pounds the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The waves pound against the shore during the storm.
meanings.sent3: She pounds the dough to make the bread fluffy.
meanings.sent4: The boxer pounds his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent5: The drummer pounds the drums with great energy.
